going full-screen on a mac

Published: 08 Feb 2009
Most popular web browsers for macs cannot go full-screen. This is a feature I used regularly before my recent switch to mac (which, by the way, has been fantastic!) Now I am happy to say that once again Google Reader is full-screened and I am loving life :] All thanks toÂ Plainview. The menubar autohides and the app supports shortcuts that feel intuitive to me: command+L brings up the location bar, command+T toggles your full-screened windows. Props to Creative Applications for this screencast. Plainview [Mac] // CreativeApplications.Net // Vimeo.
